DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Inavolisib works by blocking the activity of a protein called PI3K-alpha that signals cells to multiply. It also helps break down mutant (overactive) versions of this protein found in cancer cells. This may keep cancer cells from growing and may kill them. Inavolisib is a type of targeted therapy drug called an enzyme inhibitor. It is a small-molecule drug (a drug that can enter cells easily).

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Inavolisib is approved to be used with palbociclib and fulvestrant to treat adults with:

ItemizedList.ListItem: breast cancer that is hormone receptor positive and HER2 negative and has an abnormal PIK3CA gene. It is used for cancer that has spread and has come back during or after completing adjuvant hormone therapy.

Section.Para: Inavolisib is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
